  send ('/live/track/start_listen/color_index', '*')
  send ('/live/track/start_listen/name', '*')
  send ('/live/track/start_listen/mute', '*')
  send ('/live/track/start_listen/solo', '*')
  send ('/live/track/start_listen/arm', '*')
  send ('/live/track/start_listen/panning', '*')
  send ('/live/song/start_listen/tempo')
  send ('/live/song/start_listen/is_playing')
  send ('/live/song/start_listen/signature_denominator')
  send ('/live/song/start_listen/signature_numerator')

  send ('/live/song/start_listen/session_record')
  send ('/live/song/get/num_scenes')
  send ('/live/song/get/num_tracks')
  

//  var max=get('tracks_count')
var max=get('tracks_count')
  for (var n=0;n<max;n++){
      send ('/live/track/get/send', {type:'i',value:n}, {type:'i',value:0})
      send ('/live/track/get/send', {type:'i',value:n}, {type:'i',value:1})
      send ('/live/track/get/is_visible', {type:'i',value:n})
      send ('/live/track/get/is_grouped', {type:'i',value:n})
      send ('/live/track/get/is_foldable', {type:'i',value:n})
      }

widgets.value:
Ableton Live  Control and Feedback with OpenStageControl

• The actual Version of my layout is  v2.4     

• A big Thank-You to Jean-Emmanuel and Freddie Ventura, as this Ableton-Live-Layout is  based on there great jobs on the "ArdourRemote" and "Virtual Launchpad" Layouts.... 

• To get this LiveOSC-Layout run correctly, you must first donwload and install the free AbletonOSC-Remote-Script and than activate it in Ableton Live !! Be shure to have the latest version of AbletonOSC as there is a whole new class for Scenes, since january 2025 (with functions as "firescenes", "scenename", "scenetempo" etc)
  →  https://github.com/ideoforms/AbletonOSC   

• OSC ports are set by default ! Ableton Live is listening on Port "11000" and sending Feedback on Port "11001" ; so in OpenStageControl the ports must be set to : Input Port : "11001" and Output Send Port : "11000" .   
Remote Control and Feedback can be by Localhost (127.0.0.1) or any private Network (WiFi Routers etc)   

• This OpenStageControl Layout includes also a Virtual Launchpad (special thanks to Freddie Ventura). This Virtual Launchpad communicates with Ableton-Live by MIDI. Please select "Launchpad" as a "virtual controler" in Live"s MIDI Preferences and than set the correct (virtual) MIDI-Ports.    
   
• To get MIDI working correctly, you must use some Virtual-MIDI-Interface ( for example Virtual-MIDI-Port in MacOS (native); or third-party software as loop-MIDI or others); and configure them in the OpenStageControl-Setup and Ableton-Live-Preferences correctly.

• CSS-Styles are written directly into the layout for color rendering etc... 

• Scenes can  be played from the OSCLaunchPad with the new OSC-Function "Fire Scenes" and also from the Virtual-MIDI-Launchpad !    
• There are some lacks and limitations, and some hidden issues due to the Python-OSC-Library (of AbletonOSC); maybe some of them will be fixed in the future..??"
• There is at the moment no control on the Master-Track (but I will add it by MIDI-Control); there is no control either for the AuxReturnTracks (and they are even not shown in the TrackList !)

• About Feedback from the LiveSession :    
  For many Feedbacks there is a "start_listen" function that tells Live to send Feedback as soon as there are any changes in the session (for example : Names, Volumes, Mutes, Solo etc etc). 
• Most of these "start_listeners" are activated automatically, when the OSCLayout goes online. Others may be activated manually with the "Sync" Button. Some others may be activated via dedicated button. this is the case for Meters and also for "Playing-Clips-Feedback". 
• Please be aware that these feedbacks make send and receive a lot of OSC-Data and can slow down the whole layout !! So make sure to use only what you really need. 
  Some are not yet available.... as there are so many to include....   

• I will update this Layout in the future and add more features to it, so it may be worth to have a look at my Github-Page from time to time, to see if there are any 
  →  https://github.com/ziginfo/OpenStageControlLayouts/tree/main/Ableton-LiveOSC 

• Special Thanks to Daniel Jones for his Python-Remote-Script  →  https://github.com/ideoforms

widgets.html:
Ableton Live  Control and Feedback with OpenStageControl>

 

• The actual Version of my layout is  v2.4      

 

• A big Thank-You to Jean-Emmanuel and Freddie Ventura, as this Ableton-Live-Layout is  based on there great jobs on the 'ArdourRemote' and 'Virtual Launchpad' Layouts....

• To get this LiveOSC-Layout run correctly, you must first donwload and install the free AbletonOSC-Remote-Script here:   ( → go there...)  and than activate it in Ableton Live !!
  Be shure to have the latest version of AbletonOSC as there is a whole new class for Scenes, since january 2025 (with functions as 'firescenes', 'scenename', 'scenetempo' etc)  

• OSC ports are set by default ! Ableton Live is listening on Port '11000' and sending Feedback on Port '11001' ; so in OpenStageControl the ports must be set to : Input Port : '11001' and Output Send Port : '11000'  

• Remote Control and Feedback can be by Localhost (127.0.0.1) or any private Network (WiFi Routers etc)  

• This OpenStageControl Layout includes also a virtual Launchpad (special thanks to Freddie Ventura) which communicates with Ableton-Live by MIDI. Please select 'Launchpad' as a 'virtual controler' in Live's MIDI Preferences and than set the correct (virtual) MIDI-Ports.    

• To get MIDI working correctly, you must use some Virtual-MIDI-Interface ( for example Virtual-MIDI-Port in MacOS (native); or third-party software as loop-MIDI or others); and configure them in the OpenStageControl-Setup and Ableton-Live-Preferences correctly.

 

• CSS-Styles are now written directly into the layout for color rendering etc...

 

• Scenes can  be played from the OSCLaunchPad with the new OSC-Function 'Fire Scenes' and also from the Virtual-MIDI-Launchpad !

• There are some lacks and limitations, and some hidden issues due to the Python-OSC-Library (of AbletonOSC); maybe some of them will be fixed in the future..??'

• There is at the moment no control on the Master-Track (but I will add it by MIDI-Control); there is no control either for the AuxReturnTracks (and they are even not shown in the TrackList !)

 

• About Feedback from the LiveSession :    

  For many Feedbacks there is a 'start_listen' function that tells Live to send Feedback as soon as there are any changes in the session (for example : Names,

  Volumes, Mutes, Solo etc etc). Most of these 'start_listeners' are activated automatically, when the OSCLayout goes online. Others may be activated manually with the 'Sync' Button.

  Some others may be activated via dedicated button. this is the case for Meters and also for "Playing-Clips-Feedback".

  Please be aware that these feedbacks make send and receive a lot ofOSC-Data and can slow down the whole layout !! So make sure to use only what you really need.

  (Some are not yet available.... as there are so many to include....)  

 

• I will update this Layout in the future and add more features to it, so it may be worth to have a look at my Github-Page from time to time, to see if there are any updates... → (go there...)

 

• Special Thanks to Daniel Jones for his Python-Remote-Script → (click here for more infos !)

widgets.html:
Ableton Live Configuration

• Minimum Version: 11

• AbletonOSC must be installed in Live ! -> (click here for more infos !)

• In Live's MIDI Preferences you must select AbletonOSC and also "Launchpad" as Control-Surfaces

• And set virtual MIDI-Ports for IN and OUT for the Launchpad

• No need to set MIDI-Ports for the AbletonOSC ! (As this is OSC only)

• Default OSC Ports are 11000 for Receiving and 11001 for Sending in Live and AbletonOSC !

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Open Stage Control Configuration

• Minimum version : 1.18.0

• send : 127.0.0.1:11000

• latest layout : liveOSC_v1.8.3.json

• custom-module : live-module.js

• css-file : live.css

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

• Speacial Thanks to Jean-Emmanuel and FreddieVentura !

• I useed their O-S-C templates (Ardour and Virtual Lauchpad) as a starting point to write this Ableton-Live Template !

  get("bank_size"),
  get("trip_type_bitsum"),
  f,
  0,
  0,
  0,
  0
]

send.apply(null, args)

widgets.value:
Ableton Live  Control and Feedback with OpenStageControl - Device Tab

• About Feedback from the Ableton Live Session :    
  For many Feedbacks there is a "start_listen" function that tells Live to send Feedback as soon as there are any changes in the session (for example : Names, Volumes, Mutes, Solo etc etc). 

• Most of these "start_listeners" are activated automatically, when this OSCLayout goes online. Others can be activated manually with the "Sync" Button. Some others are activated by dedicated button. This is the case for Meters and also for "Playing-Clips-Feedback", and also for the feedback about the Device-Parameters as there are no automatic "Listerners" for these Feedbacks.

• For the Device-Parameter Feedback you can request it manually by clicking on the "Sync-One" Button or automatically by a request-loop that will send requests every second (or 2 or 3 seconds)

• Please be aware that these feedbacks make send and receive a lot of OSC-Data and can slow down the whole layout !! So make sure to use only what you really need. Especilly when you are using  server on a Computer plus the client (tablette or iPad) via Wi-Fi !! The Dato-Flow will get stuck very quickly when there are too many Feedback-Requests enabled ! 
• So, make shure to disables requests that you don't need!

• When you change the number of Device-Parameter-Strips, mau may not have all the feedback immediately (especially when going from less to more strips). In this case just hit the forward/backward buttons for the "Params Page" Change.

• The "On/Off" Buttons only appear for parameters that have on-off-triggers.

widgets.onValue:
var seltr=get('seltra_var')
var seldev=get('dev_id')-1
send('/live/track/get/num_devices',seltr)
send('/live/device/get/num_parameters',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/name',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/class_name',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/type',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/parameters/name',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/parameters/value',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/parameters/min',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/parameters/max',seltr,seldev)
send('/live/device/get/parameters/is_quantized',seltr,seldev)

var maxp=get('paramcount')
for (var n=0;n<maxp;n++){
send('/live/device/get/parameter/value_string',seltr,seldev,n)}
set('val_lbl_@{parent.variables.n}',get(this))

if (get('first_note')>=12){
set('first_note',get('first_note')-12)}

if (get('first_note')<96){
  set('first_note',get('first_note')+12)}

if (get('key_numb')>24){
set('key_numb',get('key_numb')-12)}

if (get('key_numb')<49){
  set('key_numb',get('key_numb')+12)}

if (get('midi_chan')>0){
  set('midi_chan',get('midi_chan')-1)}

if (get('midi_chan')<16){
  set('midi_chan',get('midi_chan')+1)}

widgets.label: @{arm_label}

widgets.onValue:
if (get('pad_fnote')>=16){
set('pad_fnote',get('pad_fnote')-16)}

if (get('pad_fnote')<100){
  set('pad_fnote',get('pad_fnote')+16)}

widgets.value:
•  To start using this Virtual Launchpad you must first sync it with the Live-Session and click twice on the Refresh-Button (upper-right). If nothing happens try the "File" Button (in the middle). 
•  The Launchpad should now be in "Clip-Fire-Mode" and will show active Clips and can fire them (preset Clips are colored in yellow). Playing clips are colored green. Grey Pads are empty ! Scenes can also be fired.

•  When in Mixer-Mode (click on the "Mixer" Button), the color-code changes and the functions of the Pads also have changed now (please refer to the Launchpad-Manual to understand these new actions and feedbacks)

•  There are two other Modes : User1 and User2. 
•  In User1 Mode, you can play Instruments if a track  is in record mode.
•  In User2 Mode, the MIDI-Notes implementation changes and is optimized for Drum-Pads. In fact you have now four different Pad-Arrays with 16 Pads each. The standard default Pad-Array will be the "down-left" one !
•  Please refer to the Launchpad-Manual to understand the Notes-implementation

•  Please consider the following :

•  As we use already the Virtual Launchpad as a MIDI controller on channel 1, the MIDI-Notes on Channel 1 can't be used anymore for Instruments and Track-Inputs and Drum-Pads  etc.. as these act already as Control-Triggers !
         
•  So, simply use another Midi-Channel, when you wanna play Instruments or Drums, and all will work and respond fine ! Channel 2 generally works fine. You can set the Channel with the last button on the below Menu-Buttons-Row.

•  Last Note (important) : this Virtual Launchpad has many features from the original hardware, but indeed not all; so, some of the "actions" may be a bit strange; if for example, the colors on the Pads get stuck (genrally after changing the MIDI-Channel) you can use the "Clear Colors" Button below ! This also restores MIDI-Channel 1.

•  A special thank to Freddie Ventura. This layout here is based on his tremendous work on the initial Virtual-Launchpad, that you can find on his Github Page
➞  https://github.com/freddieventura/virtual-launchpad
